Key Arguments: The legislation could negatively impact free speech in Australia.
Existing laws already address issues like defamation and inciting violence.
The bill could shut down lawful discussions on various social issues.
The bill appears to target political beliefs contrary to mainstream views.
Threatening private companies with fines could lead to excessive censorship.
The definitions of harm in the bill are vague and subjective, potentially stifling debate.
There is a lack of objective safeguards to prevent misuse of the bill.
Notable Quotes: THIS NEW BILL COULD effectively be used to SHUT DOWN ALL KINDS OF LAWFUL DISCUSSIONS about a wide range of social issues.
This could in effect GAG UNWANTED OPINIONS even if they are factual and truthful.
The definitions contained in this draft bill are also outrageously vague and subjective.
THIS IS A BROADER ATTACK ON FREE SPEECH than anything previously seen in Australia.
